actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow a credit for the purchase of principal residence by a first-time homebuyer.
popular_title: First Time Homebuyer Tax Credit bill

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow a first-time homebuyer who purchases a principal residence a tax credit of ten percent of the purchase price of such residence. Requires such residence to be purchased during the one-year period after the date of enactment of this Act. Limits the credit to $2,500.

titles.title: First Time Homebuyer Tax Credit bill
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow a credit for the purchase of principal residence by a first-time homebuyer.
